Edited on 02/15/2019
At this moment I am admitted to the Ruber hospital on Juan Bravo Street 39.
After reading, the negative comments I had about it, I arrived scared; I entered through the emergency room transferred from Pozuelo, because there were no beds there.
The receptionist's treatment was quite dry, but within the formality. The nurse and the assistant who were doing the night shift were very correct in their work, but very very serious ... And sometimes you need a smiling face
And some words of encouragement in these circumstances.
Otherwise, it works well. the rest of the staff that I have known as cleaning staff as well as assistants and nurses have also found the two doctors who have come to see me these days very pleasant. 
The only thing is that the hospital is very small, you do not have anywhere to move when you want to leave the room and go for a walk, the doctors make the visit to the sick even in the late afternoon, when you have been there all day. Although it must also be said that at least the doctors of surgery of the digestive system who have visited me have been exceptional in their personal treatment with me, I have never seen a doctor who visits the rooms that have so much with the patient and that offers such a cordial and personal treatment. When you are admitted, you need much more a good smile and a few words of affection. Ol√© by Dr. Meneu's medical team.
It should also improve in technical aspects.
But still and despite these little things, the hospital works well.

I speak from my own experience, from relatives, acquaintances and users with whom I deal daily. Nada recomendable. Ha bajado mucho el nivel y cuentan con m√©dicos, que aunque tambi√©n atiendan en otros lugares, no son buenos profesionales. Pocas revisiones deben de hacer para ver c√≥mo atienden y lo que recetan. En el caso de mi madre, que falleci√≥ hace un mes de c√°ncer, la Doctora Vasc√≥nez, especialista del aparato digestivo, en su primera visita, no le hizo ni revisi√≥n. Le recet√≥ un f√°rmaco que no est√° indicado para gente mayor, y mi madre tiene 85.
Yo misma fui a que me atendiera despu√©s y pude comprobar de primera mano que su trato es fatal. De ah√≠ pas√≥ a otros m√©dicos, pero el tiempo de espera fue muy largo entre visita y visita as√≠ que optamos por llevarla a urgencias.
Result√≥ que mi madre ten√≠a c√°ncer de colon en estado terminal. Los que fueron excelentes detect√°ndolo es el servicio de urgencias del hospital de San Pablo, que es p√∫blico.
En cuanto a la directora del centro, muy amable pero no resolvi√≥ nada. Me coment√≥ que lo sent√≠a, pero que sus m√©dicos visitaban en muchos hospitales y que los tiempos de espera eran los correctos. Mejor miren otras aseguradoras m√°s competentes.

Nothing recommended. The level has dropped a lot and they have doctors who, although they also attend other places, are not good professionals. Few reviews should be done to see how they attend and what they prescribe. In the case of my mother, who died a month ago of cancer, Dr. Vasc√≥nez, a specialist in the digestive system, on her first visit, did not do a review. He prescribed a drug that is not indicated for older people, and my mother is 85.
I went to see him later and I could see firsthand that his treatment is fatal. From there it happened to other doctors, but the waiting time was very long between visits and visits, so we opted to take it to the emergency room.
It turned out that my mother had terminal colon cancer. Those who were excellent at detecting it is the emergency department of the San Pablo hospital, which is public.
As for the director of the center, very friendly but did not solve anything. He told me that he was sorry, but that his doctors visited many hospitals and that the waiting times were correct. Better look at other more competent insurers.

I had to get an urgent radiology test that required contrast. When I called to get an appointment, they told me that I had to take the doctor's request and the insurance card (nothing else). They sent me an email describing the preparations prior to the test and that I had to sign a consent before doing the test, but there was no consent attached to the email. I did not give importance, I assumed that they would give me the consent to sign it before the test. The day came to go to Quiron, the girl asked me for the doctor's request the card and signed consent. I told him that the consent was not sent to me in the email and he told me that without that paper they could not do the test, because it had to be signed and sealed by the doctor who had made the request. I showed him the email and he could see that Quiron had not attached the paper. She entered radiology to ask the doctor and when she returned accompanied by a lightning technician, they told me that it was impossible to perform the test without that paper. I did not understand anything, as long as I signed a consent I signed it and the doctor who performed the test, not the one who requested it. I tried to locate the doctor who requested the test but did not have a consultation that day. The paper of the consent they had there printed but as they said to me that only with my signature it was not worth, they did not do the test to me what supposed an enormous backwardness in other tests that had to do to me after this. The frustration made me want to call Quiron Bilbao to inform me if they worked with the same system and the girl told me that what I had been told in Donosti did not make any sense since the signed consent I have to sign that I am the one who has to consent to be tested. In Bilbao they explained to me that before carrying out the test they give me the paper to sign and ready ...

On 11-30-19 at 4:17 p.m. we went to our pediatric emergency department with our son because he spent the night with a fever after the end of the previous day an antibiotic treatment with augmentine 100mg / ml for some plaques in his throat.

We told him that when he went through triage he had no fever that he would take his temperature again before giving him the medicine. It brings the triage thermometer to consultation and is not able to take the temperature with it so it refers us to the triage nurse to be taken again. The nurse takes it again using the same thermometer without any problem resulting in 36.6 again, so that no medication is given to the child. He looks at his throat and indicates that he has plaque, so he decides to extend the antibiotic treatment he had been taking for 3 days before prescribing a generic antibiotic with the same active substance as augmentine but with a composition of 250mg / 5ml. When we go to the pharmacy to buy this generic medication, the pharmacist tells us that the prescription does not make much sense since the amount of medication that the doctor has indicated in the prescription is much less than what I had been taking in children before, explaining , with a lot of common sense, that if the previous treatment has not been able to eliminate plaque completely, lengthening the antibiotic treatment for 3 days more than the amount initially taken in principle does not believe that it will get it either because of it and Before a possible error in the medical prescription, the pharmacist tells us to contact the doctor to confirm that the indicated doses are correct.
Given the mistrust generated by the doctor motivated by all the aforementioned, we decided to present ourselves again in the emergency room of another hospital so that they value the child. After going through triage and medical consultation, the doctor of this other hospital diagnoses that the child has no plaque and that the fever of the previous night has been caused by a virus that has nothing to do with the process that he had been suffering previously and that at those times, being 20.00h does not have a fever either for those who send us home without prescribing any medication, indicating to give paracetamol if the child has pain or fever only.
Finally, we are left with a feeling of bad attention from this pediatric emergency doctor who supplies medication without attending to the information indicated by her nurses, prescribes medications without any sense and sees plaque where according to other professionals in her field she does not come.
For those responsible for the Hospital, choose well the medical professionals who care for people and even more to the smallest ones that in the face of more serious situations I don't even want to imagine.

OPERATION...I had a huge spine operation, 4 discs removed, plates, screws, cages bone grafts done in March in this hospital..I had been told nothing more could be done for me in UK after a previous failed spine surgery.  The Spanish consultant was Sandra Rodriguez Barcello... This woman is AWESOME, an absolutely BRILLIANT surgeon.   I would highly recommend her to anyone in pain..  she is a very caring, kind and unassuming lady..  I cannot speak highly enough of her skill as a surgeon.   I Am 63 years old and prior to this operation I could barely move ..  this wonderful lady gave me my life back.. I will never be able to thank her enough.
HOSPITAL CLEANLINESS...  AMAZING....THE CLEANING TEAMS ARE IMMACULATELY DRESSED IN BRILLIANTLY WHITE UNIFORMS.. THIS HOSPITAL IS SPOTLESSLY CLEAN  THROUGHOUT.. AT ALL TIMES.
AFTERCARE.. NURSING..  Due to the language barrier, the after care in Spanish hospitals is not the same as the nursing care in Uk.  I did not have any monitors on after the operation.  There is not water beside your bed, you are in a private room and unless you press the button for attention you are left to your own devices.  Arrange for a member of family to be on hand at all times for your personal needs.
I would like to say a big thank you to one nurse in particular, ANDRES BOSQUE ARIAS, he was the kindest, caring and most considerate person, he was like a light at the end of a dark tunnel and really took the time to make me feel supported and safe immediately following my surgery.
PHYSIOTHERAPY AND REHABILITATION ..  WHAT A WONDERFUL TEAM THESE MAKE... THEY ARE A LIKE A VERY WELL OILED MACHINE THAT RUNS, SMOOTHLY AND EFFICIENTLY AT ALL TIMES.
Anabel Galuez Belando is my main physiotherapist.  Jesus Diat Moron is my main Rehabilitation trainer, Marina Autequera is also physiotherapy, and Fidel Moreno Morales is also Rehabilitation.  This team of people are the most highly trained in their field, I have had really debilitating  (night time) irritable legs for many years. the UK doctors, surgeons, all said the same thing, take anti depression tablets to suppress nerves ..  between Jesus and Ana, they completely cured this on first attempt, and when it comes back, they get rid of it again.  Whenever I get hamstring pain, they cure it immediately.  They all know exactly where to pinpoint every muscle, ligament that doesn't work or is inflamed.  They are like magicians.  In 5 weeks I can honestly, with my hand on my heart say that they have made me strong and able to do exercise's that I have not done for 13 years, I am now gaining muscle and losing fat.  The atmosphere is so positive and energising, they make you feel happy and strong.  I cannot wait for each session and I am a 63 year old, overweight person that has never done any real exercise in her life, a desk job all my life hasn't helped.  I HONESTLY BELIEVE YOU WILL NOT FIND A BETTER TEAM ANYWHERE IN SPAIN.
ADMINISTRATION AND RECEPTION .. The receptionist are like any hospital, doctors anywhere, you have the odd rude, unhelpful ones but these are far outweighed by the EXTREMELY KIND AND HELPFUL ONES.  We have to understand how frustrating it must be to be presented with an English speaking person who does not know any Spanish.. How daunting that must be to a Spanish only speaking receptionist.  A Massive thank you to the staff that took the time to speak to me in English.  A lovely lady by the name of Marian Martinez  has helped me tremendously with all aspects of Administration, translation and general assistance in any area.  She is kind, considerate and extremely efficient.
I am very sorry to say that I do not know the lady Director of the hospitals name who assists in all appointments, insurance dealings,  and running of administration in the hospital, she is also Super efficient, kind and considerate.. TO SUM UP...  IN MY OPINION, DON'T CONSIDER ANY OTHER HOSPITAL IF YOU ARE LOOKING FOR THE FINEST OVERALL PACKAGE, THE FINEST SURGEONS, THE FINEST PHYSIOTHERAPISTS AND REHABILITATION TEAMS., ETC., .

After several years of going to this hospital I have finally decided never to return, I will explain my reasons. 
Six years ago (18 years old) with a constant pain in the hip during sports and also at rest, I decided to visit a trauma surgeon (Dr. Robert) who asked me for a CT scan and some resonance. The results indicated that there was a certain pathology in the hip but according to his criteria not enough to operate or treat in any way, in the following appointments, insisting on the pain and incapacitation that resulted from this, I ended up diagnosing psoas rupture (a muscle that is very difficult to break). I did up to 1 month and a half of rehabilitation sessions and to practice all that effort was useless pq did not have any psoas injury. This week I was operated at the Clinica Cima de BCN for labrum rupture and hip dysplasia, which they detected almost immediately and the citation to the operation in less than 1 month. Thanks General Hospital for all the time lost and thousands of tests (especially the 3 or 4 TACS REPRESENTING A VERY IMPORTANT AMOUNT MPORTNTE OF RADIATION IN THE PATIENT, is to denounce seriously). 
And this does not end here, during this last year I suffered symptoms that I had never experienced, chronic pharyngitis, muscle weakness, etc. And the doctors who have treated me (4 times of urgency, otorrino (one Valery Nu√±ez very lost and finally the doctor "head" Montserrat) have not been able to give me a reliable diagnosis but the answer was a huge amount of medicines and tests and valuations without sense .. It could be more extensive but I find it boring .. Fatal.
Finally in the social security, in the Cap of my town, with a blood test I have found problems with the thyroid that generate these symptoms and thus be able to treat them correctly.
Therefore, my assessment of this hospital is terrible, as I said; the lost time, the bad diagnoses and the general carelessness of the doctors (none have shown real interest or any kind of closeness to the patient) in summary, HORROROSO.

We are trapped in the gift and commerce between the Community of Madrid and public hospitals with private management.
In this case with the General Hospital of Villalba, whose owners and managers are Chiron.
The hospital mentioned has the habit of changing reports as time goes by. They do not add for new tests. They erase and correct the diagnosis respecting the date of the first report.
If the tests have not been informed, when the specialist sees you, nothing happens, he tells you that you are well, he discharges you and a few days later the report arrives, they add it to the previous date and it is resolved.
They did electromyographies of all four limbs, they reported them the same day, they did x-rays, they didn't appear.
I had three resonances of the spine, cervical, dorsal and lumbar, they did not report. These tests were made on August 12, 2019.
On August 16, the traumatologist received me and since the X-rays were not there, he told me to come down and ask for them.
He saw the electromyography report and went on to inform me of the resonances. At that time he did not have the report of these tests. He told me everything was fine.

I entered the Hospital La Luz on March 4, 2019, through admission authorized by Adeslas, due to a flyer issued by my neurologist, who tells me that she is the Chief of Service in that Hospital, which read as follows: "Neuropathy of unknown origin. Study to rule out borreliosis. " To do this, the neurologist proposed a lumbar puncture to have samples of cerebrospinal fluid.

Well, I entered, delivering, among the documents, that of Authorization adding in my handwriting the following: "And asking me to practice local anesthesia in the intervention to be performed." In March 2018, I had heart surgery at the Ruber International Hospital, where a biological valve was placed and repair of dilatation of the ascending aorta by vascular prosthesis.
 
Shortly after entering, after an hour or an hour and a half, my neurologist appeared in my room to have my lumbar puncture. I, with the normal nightgown that patients wear, I placed myself in the bed of my room in the position that my neurologist advised me. Without following any previous procedure of any protocol and without providing me with any local anesthesia, as I had expressly requested in writing, he introduced the needle. At first with little pain, then with more growing pain until I came to scream very loudly, asking to get out of there. My loud screaming I think it had to be heard by the whole plant. After that, the neurologist extracted the needle without having obtained any sample of liquid and left my room.
 
I then sat down, with discomfort in the left back, where I had been punctured, until almost 5:00 p.m., without eating or drinking anything because they wanted to make me, after the failure of the puncture, another study using X-rays with opaque contrast, to which I refused because I did not know the effect in me of the aforementioned contrast. And due to that other study to be done I had no food or drink since 8:00, when I joined, until about 5:00 pm when they brought me a tiny snack and a tablet against the pain caused for the damage done and described above.
 
In short, a complete disaster. Already, in the evening almost night, I was given to fill a HIGH VOLUNTEER in which, I said, "I undergo lumbar puncture without following any protocol, without local anesthesia, having requested it in writing." I shouted loudly, "I was made damage and, in addition, no liquid was obtained ". The model did not give to expose in detail everything that I expose here. I signed it with the date of the same day that I entered, on March 4, 2019, and it was signed by a responsible doctor of the Hospital as well.

I edit the comment so that it is clear that it is a real opinion. If I call consulting if they do tests of potential evoked to children under three years, it is because I know that not all clinics do it. If I call, I consult, they confirm that they are done (they even gave me a price), they give me an appointment for a month and a half later, I call back later to confirm that in neurophysium they are aware of age and they reiterate, they confirm that " without any problem "for a month later call me when the date approaches to indicate otherwise, I can not help but be surprised and indignant in equal parts and think that the only thing I have achieved is to lose a month and a half in a period where speed is fundamental to treat a possible problem.

With these data I suppose that they will be enough to verify the veracity, however, just in case it was not the only time that they give appointment for a test that they do NOT perform, the initials are ISR and LSR.

content: The emergency services to the Quiron Hospital is very good. I brought my husband on Sunday night at midnight with stomach pains (he has gallstones) and he was seen to straightaway and put on a drip. At 2:30am, he was admitted to the hospital. His bloods were taken. He was given a room on the 3rd floor, a gown and the nurses keeps coming in to check his Blood Pressure and change his drips. They said that the doctor would come see him in the morning. We waited and waited all morning, the nurses says that the doctor has to do his rounds for BOTH 2nd and 3rd floor (This is PRIVATE hospital!! Surely there should be more than 1 doctor?????!!!!). We were patient and waited. The doctor finally comes in at 12 noon. He came in, checked my husband's stomach (any pain there, any pain here?), said that he cannot make a decision and will try to get in contact with the surgeon and in the meantime will send my husband for a scan. The scanner told him that he has a big gallstone and will write this in his report to the doctor/surgeon. My husband was back in his room at 1pm. Since then, NO OTHER DOCTOR came to see us to explain what is going on. The nurses are clueless as they have only been left with the instructions to change his drips/blood pressure and no eating or drinking. So, we were left in limbo.... don't know whats going on... will he be operated today, tomorrow, how long will he need to go without eating... NOTHING!  This is absolutely DISGRACEFUL for a private hospital! I think we would have got attended more in a Public Hospital!! DISGRACEFUL!!!!!!! We are so angry with this service. VERY VERY BAD SERVICE in hospitalisation!!

Direcci√≥n: Avenida De Los Empresarios Edificio Arttysur

The truth is a shame, and more to be private and with private medical insurance. I went to the emergency room for a broken hand, it took me 2 and a half hours to leave the hospital. They plastered my hand.
For the next appointments a disaster, the doctor told me to come back in 2 weeks, and my surprise was when they told me they were giving appointments for 5 weeks ...

I appear before the new doctor, for which he tells me that the plaster was unnecessary, go ...
They bring me like a puppet, now go to this building, now next door, then come back, climb 6 floors on foot because the elevators are stuck, anyway.
Right now they have me in radiology, to do some new studies. I came by appointment, and yet I have been waiting for more than an hour and a half. I am sure that my visit does not come down for 3 hours this day, for something that if they wanted and well organized, it would take 10-15 minutes.
For my surprise after 1 hour and a half of waiting they leave to say that the 2 machines they have are not working. They calculate that it takes at least 1 more hour to return patients.
After everyone gets mad, they tell us to move to the clinic located at number 39. It took me 15 minutes to have a 2-minute x-ray, to return to the initial doctor again, to finally finish this odyssey .
Both times that I have visited the center, the discomfort of delay and waiting is heard in all clients. It is a shame and I am extremely upset with the treatment received from the center (not from the staff). Bad management, regardless of patient time. At the moment the center has a 2.2 score, and I feel that it is much higher than it deserves.
In short, I do not recommend this center to anyone!

Los dos nos miramos con cara de preocupaci√≥n. Finalmente le pincho la mano para ponerle el suero y sacarle sangre y como podr√°n ver en las fotos tiro sangre por todos lados. Dejo un charco de sangre en el suelo, much√≠simas gasas llenas de sangre y cuando le reclamamos nos dijo que "eso es lo que pasa cuando se pincha una vena". Al final no le saco  sangre porque no pudo, tuvo que venir otra enfermera con experiencia a hacerlo directamente del brazo. La otra enfermera fue muy amable, pero Janet no solamente no sabe hacer su trabajo, sino que adem√°s nos respondi√≥ a la defensiva cuando le cuestionamos porque no hab√≠a pedido ayuda. Yesterday night we went to the Emergency Room of Juan Bravo Ruber since my husband had poisoning. In the emergency room, they sent him to have blood drawn and put in serum. The nurse "Janet" who was the one who put the track had no experience, and even mentioned it to us when we asked if it was better to puncture her hand or arm, "for me it is better to have a hand because I do not have much experience doing this" . We both looked at each other with a worried face. Finally I prick his hand to put the serum and draw blood and as you can see in the pictures I throw blood everywhere. I leave a puddle of blood on the floor, a lot of gauze full of blood and when we complained he told us that "that's what happens when a vein is punctured". In the end I did not draw blood because he could not, had to come another experienced nurse to do it directly by the arm. The other nurse was very kind, but Janet not only does not know how to do her job, but she also responded defensively when we questioned her because she had not asked for help. I am 8 months pregnant and I do not have to go to corajes with unprofessional people. The least we expected was an apology on his part, since my husband, besides being sick, became pale from all the blood he lost. In short, terrible, terrible, terrible attention. My recommendation: Go to any other hospital and beware of nurse Janet who is not trained to do her job and is also aggressive and lacks respect for patients.

Como se suele decir, me toco la china!! en la tarde del dia de Navidad 25 de diciembre de 2018, acudi al hospital Ruber Juan Bravo de Urgencias por un atascamiento alimenticio en el esofago, me atendieron muy lentamente, habia en la sala unas seis personas,  atendia una doctora, no recuerdo su nombre, pero si que era de origen latino, llegue sobre las ocho y media, tardaron dos horas en darme el resultado de una placa, mientras yo esperaba en la sala de espera con sensacion de ahogo y con multiples arcadas que me hacian estar entrando y saliendo del ba√±o, sobre las 22:30 h. aprox. me llama la doctora y me comunica que en la placa no se aprecia nada, yo  continuo sin tan siquiera poder tragar saliva, entoces la doctora me recomienda acudir a un "buen hospital" o ha la Clinica San Jose en la calle Cartagena que alli si tienen servicio de urgencias de otorrino, salimos a toda prisa mi mujer y yo hacia la calle Cartagena, al llegar alli nos dicen que alli no tienen urgencias de otorrino!!! la desesperacion fue total, entonces mi mujer opto por la Seguridad Social, llebandome al Gregorio Mara√±on, alli me informaron que no era el Otorrino quien tenia que verme , si no el de Digestivo, ( que desastre de doctora) me hicieron una endoscopia de urgencias y  debido al tiempo que habia pasado desde el atascamiento y su retirada, se produjo una imactacion con desgarro esofagico,  total; desde el 25 por la tarde hasta el dia 6 de enero ingresado en el Gregorio Mara√±on.
He de confesar mi decepcion  con el Hospital Ruber  que yo pensaba que era uno de los mejores, he escrito a su correo electronico para que tengan constancia de mi queja, desconozco si ese dia por ser festivo estaban en huelga de brazos caidos o que tenian servicios minimos por alguna causa, que no estaba anunciada, desde luego si no hay servicios de urgencia generales, lo deberian avisar a las aseguradoras,
Despues de la experiencia no regresaremos mas a este hospital y sobre todo advertir al resto de usuarios de que lo que me ocurrio a mi, le puede pasar acualquiera.

As they say, I play the china !! I have to confess my disappointment with the Ruber Hospital, which I thought was one of the best, I have written to your email so that they are aware of my complaint, I do not know if that day because it was a holiday they were on a sit-down strike or that they had services minimum for some reason, which was not announced, of course if there are no general emergency services, they should notify the insurers,
After the experience, we will no longer return to this hospital and, above all, warn the rest of the users that what happened to me can happen to anyone.

Where to start I had the pregnancy scheduled and should be on day X at 8:00 in the hospital. Upon arrival, there was no free room. They had us waiting two and a half hours in a hallway. Then, as there was still no room, they passed me directly to the parlor, with all the bags in which we carried our "luggage" for those days. All very hygienic and bacteria free. I spent all the dilation and delivery in the delivery room, about 8 long hours. Butt oxytocin, I suppose to recover the lost time, with the consequent brutal contractions and no space between them. When I asked for the anesthetist to come, the least time they made me wait, it took about 45 minutes to come. Other times I had less luck and it took an hour, hour and peak. I arrived at the time of delivery almost without anesthesia. The matron, cloth. He told me he was going to explore me. When I told him that he was hurting me, he replied that it was normal because I had broken my bag. Thus, without informing me or consulting me before. During childbirth, I tried to push the baby from my stomach to get it out faster. I told him to stop and, fortunately, at least this time he stopped. As for the hospital stay, horrifying. A room at 26¬∫C at the end of October. There was air conditioning, which we had to turn on from time to time, because it was unbearable. I don't think it's especially advisable to turn on an air conditioner in a room with a newborn, but that's what it was. The disastrous organization. You could not rest for 5 minutes. When someone did not come in to change the sheets, they came for the towels, or to clean the bathroom, or take the temperature to the baby, or see the cord, or bring food, or take food, or weigh the girl ... true, a no stop. At night this improved, of course, but there was the night staff chattering down the hall toooooda night. Coming home was a break.
On the subject of breastfeeding, better not talk. I left there with some terrible wounds, which almost 7 weeks later have not yet disappeared completely because of how deep they became. They told me it was normal, and to use Purelin. The girl had a book brace and they didn't even tell me. I almost had to give up breastfeeding as a result of this bad start. We have spent a pasture to continue with mixed breastfeeding and giving thanks that we are not only with the formula.
In addition, every time they have tested the girl in this hospital, they have asked me birth weight, discharge weight and data that they are supposed to have, since she was born there.
The subject of the probe, to make a urological analysis, also had its crumb. We had a lot of time waiting. When I told the nurse that I had to give the girl to eat, that she had not eaten for too long, she told me to wait, that they were going to attend us. When they put the probe, besides pissing her off a lot, oh surprise, she was dry and there was nothing pee. They asked me to feed him and wait. And again to probe it. Total, the girl without eating a lot of hours (we were between 11 and 15 in the hospital), very pissed off and we ate at 18 in the afternoon.
The only positive is Dr. R√≠os, who assisted me in childbirth and, along with Dr. Ord√≥√±ez, followed me up. They are the reason why I decided to give birth in this hospital. Dr. R√≠os is very professional, serious at work, and super positive during childbirth. It was a relief to see her come through the door and I hope she soon finds a better place to work.

Delante m√≠o lo ha consultado en su ordenador y a continuaci√≥n ha rectificado y ha dicho que no, que √©l no iba a hacerme la radiograf√≠a. Finalmente no ha habido diagn√≤stico al respecto del dolor costal. No me ha hecho ninguna palpaci√≥n tor√°cica para comprobar el estado de la costilla, no me ha mirado con un ec√≥grafo la zona, y como le he dicho que el dolor empez√≥ con un ataque de tos, se ha limitado a solicitar ponerme un nebulizador de corticoide, cosa que no he querido administrarme ya que el total desconocimiento mostrado por este doctor sobre una cosa tan evidente como es no aplicar rayos a una embarazada ha minado por completo mi confianza en su criterio. I went to the ER with intense rib pain that looked like a rib fissure, being 6 months pregnant with an apparent gut. The doctor who has treated me wanted to have an X-ray and when I stressed that I was (more than evidently) pregnant, he told me that he is not an obstetrician, that he did not know whether or not he could be already 27 weeks old, and that he was to consult it on the internet .. In front of me he consulted it on his computer and then rectified and said no, that he was not going to do the x-ray. Finally, there has been no diagnosis regarding rib pain. He has not done any thoracic palpation to check the state of the rib, he has not looked at the area with an ultrasound, and as I told him that the pain started with a coughing attack, he has just asked to apply a corticoid nebulizer , which I did not want to administer because the total ignorance shown by this doctor about such an obvious thing as not to apply rays to a pregnant woman has completely undermined my confidence in her judgment. If I neglect, he does an X-ray in a 6-month-old fetus. If I say that going to this clinic has been a nonsense I fall short. I am scared of the negligence they have been able to commit.

Cuando llegas al mostrador obviamente preguntas y te dicen que ‚Äúhay un poquito de demora... sin importancia, que los m√©dicos acaban de volver de comer y ahora hay m√°s movimiento‚Äù, vamos ech√°ndole la culpa a ellos. Eso te lo comenta una recepcionista de urgencias mientras su compa√±era est√° trasteando en instagram con su m√≥vil personal, haciendo capturas de pantalla y reenviandolas a las amigas. Todo muy profesional. Dejen de tirar balones fuera ‚Äúmuy se√±ores m√≠os ‚Äú y digan que en realidad un domingo cualquiera tienen solo a dos m√©dicos de urgencia. Que se les tendr√≠a que caer la cara de verg√ºenza.

(Translated by Google)
A pity, that a private center has delays almost daily in the emergency room. When I say delays, I mean there were people who had been waiting for five hours. When you arrive at the counter you obviously ask questions and they tell you that "there is a little bit of delay ... unimportant, that the doctors have just come back from eating and now there is more movement", we are going to blame them. That's what an emergency receptionist tells you while her partner is fiddling on Instagram with her personal cell phone, taking screenshots and sending them back to friends. Everything very professional. Stop throwing balls out "very gentlemen" and say that in fact on any Sunday they have only two emergency doctors. That they would have to face their face with shame.

Nombre del establecimiento: Hospital Universitario Ruber Juan Bravo (C/ Juan Bravo, 39)
content:
D√≠a 25 Navidad del 2018, llego a Urgencias de la Rub√©r Quir√≥n  Juan Bravo, sobre las 21:10h. me dicen que espere en la sala de espera, habria siete personas, me avisan a las 21: 50h. para que me vea la doctora, le comento que se me atasco por la ma√±ana un trozo de comida, que logre vomitar y que sobre las siete de la tarde al tomar una pastilla se me habia quedado atascada en el tubo digestivo y que no conseguia bajarla ni bebiendo agua, sin poder tragar ni saliva, si pod√≠a respirar,  pero muy nervioso y agitado,  me atiende la doctora que hab√≠a, Dra. Ana Lucia R.M. , muy poco cordial, hasta el punto de parecer antip√°tica, me manda una placa, mientras espero en la sala de espera, espero y espero entre el agotamiento que sent√≠a y la sensaci√≥n de abandono, por fin me llama, eran las 23:50h., la doctora me informa no se observa nada en la placa, todo normal!!! Me quedo estupefacto..yo sigo sin poder tragar y me duele el pecho.. .
Su respuesta: Yo que usted me hiba a una buen hospital que tengan de todo o a la cl√≠nica San Jos√© C/ Cartagena que all√≠ si tienen urgencias de otorrinolaring√≥logo, cogemos el coche y nos dirigimos a la Cl√≠nica San Jos√©,  cuando llegamos, las recepcionista nos dicen que all√≠ no tienen urgencias de otorrinolaring√≥logo..deseperado nos vamos al Hospital Gregorio mara√±√≥n de la Seguridad social, hab√≠an pasado unas 3 horas desde que acud√≠ a La Ruber, llegue al Gregorio Mara√±√≥n urgencias, me vieron tan flojo que me metieron al vox nada mas contar lo que me pasaba,  me tuvieron que hacer varias endoscopias y quitar lo que hab√≠a atascado,  por el tiempo transcurrido se agrav√≥ la lesi√≥n del es√≥fago provocandome  impactacion esofagica severa.  Pase por quir√≥fano dos veces, horrible, indignante por parte de una cl√≠nica con nombre RUBER QUIRON,  dejaron pr√°cticamente desatendida las urgencias.  Otra cosa es que aquella "doctora" que seg√∫n he le√≠do por la red es experta en temas oncologicos, me mando a otorrinolaring√≥logo y era a Digestivo.
El caso es que esto sucedi√≥ el d√≠a 25, estamos a d√≠a 4 de enero, sigo hospitalizado, con comida por vena y muy bien atendido en la Seguridad social, reconozco que estoy sorprendido por ello.
Hoy dia 30 de enero he querido afinar un poco mas la rese√±a que en su dia publique en este portal, nadie absolutamente nadie de atenci√≥n al paciente de la cadena Quir√≥n se ha puesto en contacto con con migo, ni siquiera una carta de disculpa, la contestaci√≥n que tienen todas las rese√±as aqui publicadas, pienso que debe ser una computadora que contesta por inercia, tambien mande una reclamaci√≥n al email que pone en la contestacion a la rese√±a, recibi contestaci√≥n en mi email: pasaremos nota al departamento correspondiente!!ü§î..por nuestra parte no volveremos m√°s a este hospital, el trato y diagn√≥stico fueron pesimos.

(Translated by Google)
Day 25 Christmas of 2018, arrived at the Emergency of the Rubir Quir√≥n Juan Bravo, about 21: 10h. they tell me to wait in the waiting room, there would be seven people, they tell me at 9:50 pm. so that the doctor sees me, I tell her that I got stuck in the morning a piece of food, that I managed to vomit and that at seven o'clock in the afternoon when taking a pill I was stuck in the digestive tract and I could not lower it not drinking water, without being able to swallow or saliva, if I could breathe, but very nervous and agitated, the doctor who attended me, Dr. Ana Lucia RM , very unfriendly, to the point of appearing unfriendly, sends me a plaque, while I wait in the waiting room, I wait and wait between the exhaustion I felt and the feeling of abandonment, finally calling me, it was 11:50. , the doctor informs me nothing is observed on the plate, everything normal! I'm stupefied ... I still can not swallow and my chest hurts ..
Your answer: I would like you to go to a good hospital that has everything or to the clinic San Jos√© C / Cartagena, there if you have an otolaryngologist's emergency, we take the car and go to the San Jos√© Clinic, when we arrived, the receptionist they say that there is no need for an otolaryngologist. We are going to the Gregorio Mara√±√≥n Social Security Hospital, it had been about 3 hours since I went to La Ruber, I arrived at the Gregorio Mara√±√≥n emergency, they saw me so lazy that they put me to the vox. more to tell what happened to me, I had to do several endoscopies and remove what was stuck, for the time elapsed the lesion of the esophagus worsened provoking severe esophageal impaction. I went through the surgery twice, horrible, outrageous by a clinic named RUBER QUIRON, they left practically unattended the emergencies. Another thing is that "doctor" that I have read through the network is an expert in oncology issues, I am referred to an otolaryngologist and was a Digestive.
The fact is that this happened on the 25th, we are on January 4, I am still hospitalized, with food by vein and very well taken care of in Social Security, I recognize that I am surprised by it.
Today, January 30, I wanted to refine a little more the review that I published on this website, nobody, nobody, any patient service of the Quir√≥n chain has contacted with me, not even a letter of apology, the Answer that all the reviews published here have, I think it must be a computer that answers by inertia, also send a claim to the email that you put in the reply to the review, I received an answer in my email: we will pass a note to the corresponding department! ü§î. On our part we will not return to this hospital anymore, the treatment and diagnosis were heavy.

Nombre del establecimiento: Hospital Universitario Ruber Juan Bravo (C/ Juan Bravo, 39)

My son had to be admitted on Thursday, December 12. We went to the emergency room and the treatment seemed wonderful to us since they let both mom and dad in. The treatment in the emergency room was unbeatable with a very attentive doctor and very nice and kind nurses and assistants. They told us that he had to stay in the hospital .... At dawn from 12 to 13 they gave us a room .... That night my son began to get worse, although he was already going up from the emergency room with oxygen and an IV line. At the morning shift change, the nurse who came in realized that my 3-month-old son was much worse and called the pediatrician, the speed was amazing ... Quick they put him on a high flow respirator ...
We left on Wednesday the 18th with a lot of cough, but with the satisfaction of having met a wonderful pediatric team, we came from having been in an emergency at another hospital where they told us it was nothing ...
The change for us was very satisfactory since my son is not 100% but he will spend Christmas at home. Thanks to all the pediatric team from the emergency room to the ward.
Thanks to the cleaning girls for always coming into our room with a big smile.
But above all thanks to our nurse we do not remember your name but for us you were the change that my son needed when he got so sick ...
Merry Christmas! The family of the former room 115 üçæüçæ

URGENCIAS P√â-SI-MO

Gesti√≥n del control de entrada de visitantes: no se solicita DNI para visitar a los pacientes ingresados en el box, y llevar as√≠ un control, puede pasar cualquiera que diga que es hijo, por ejemplo.
Desinformaci√≥n absoluta:  al preguntar al personal sanitario (enfermeras de mostradores de los box) si ha pasado o no alg√∫n doctor a visitar al paciente ingresado durante las ausencias de los acompa√±antes, directamente no hay respuesta.
Trato del personal santario: este es el problema m√°s grave. Ante cualquier pregunta  formulada en tono normal y con educaci√≥n contestan, para sorpresa,  de forma altanera, chulesca y con dejes ir√≥nicos, que te hacen quedarte con la boca abierta sin saber que responder, solo dar la vuelta y dar las gracias (por nada).
No es plato de buen gusto para nadie tener un familiar ingresado en un hospital, pero ya en estas urgencias es apote√≥sico.
En mi vida he visto un trato as√≠ de un personal sanitario, del que no pido humanidad ni simpat√≠a,  pido trato cordial y con un m√≠nimo de educaci√≥n, nada m√°s.

(Translated by Google)
URGENCIES P√â-SI-MO

Management of visitor entry control: DNI is not requested to visit patients admitted to the box, and thus carry out a check, anyone who says they are a child, for example, can pass.
Absolute disinformation: when asking the health staff (nurses at the check-in counters) if a doctor has visited the patient admitted during the absence of the companions, there is no answer.
Treatment of health personnel: this is the most serious problem. For any question asked in normal tone and with education they answer, to surprise, in a haughty, cuddly and ironic way, that makes you stay with your mouth open without knowing what to answer, just turn around and say thank you (for nothing) .
It is not good taste for anyone to have a family member admitted to a hospital, but in these emergencies it is apotheosis.
In my life I have seen such treatment of a health staff, from which I do not ask for humanity or sympathy, I ask for cordial treatment and with a minimum of education, nothing more.

(In a hospital entering through emergencies and without anyone in front waiting for your turn!)
One, picking up their things to go home and the other looking at papers or knowing.
When I could not take it anymore, I asked them please if they could help me.

I, from the pain, could hardly talk or stand up, so my husband gave them my card and my ID.
What was our surprise? Instead of treating me quickly and leaving my husband doing paperwork, they told us in bad manners that by going private we had to fill out a series of papers, a payment contract and photocopy my credit card before attending to me.
We knew at all times that we were going private, and that therefore we would pay our bill without any problem at the end of the emergency visit.

What is DENIGRANTE is that they had me standing without ATTENDING and asking for cards and papers when I was broken with pain that I could not hold a pen in my hand.
Would not it be more HUMAN, that someone would have taken care of me while my husband filled out the papers and photocopied all the credit cards they wanted?
In the end, as I could not even speak of pain and the blonde lady with the reception glasses did not even notice and only made us fill out papers and photocopies, we went to another hospital running.
RESULT: acute appendicitis operated from the emergency department !! BRAVO for the humanity and professionalism of the reception staff of the Dexeus !! NEGLIGENCE IN ALL RULE! THE ONLY THING THAT MATTERS IS MONEY! What a shame.
I will never again go to a center of his and, of course, I will study any possible way of claim and / or complaint.

Good afternoon. I told my nurse so much that the nurse (who told me that what I had to do was file a complaint due to lack of staff, when my complaint was made for lack of professionalism as well as for their unwillingness to work) and to the Doctor (who told me that this was not her job, but the nurse's job, if it is not the job of a doctor to worry about the health of a 6-month patient ... then whose?). We had been 6 hours, the girl was still feverish and had not eaten anything due to lack of appetite since the morning she had had 40 pap. And since we arrived, they had not made any observations or any other evidence, they did not even think about putting the serum until we asked for it, as well as the blood test.
There was a change of guard and at about 1 in the morning (after 10 hours) the second doctor GIVES US THE OPTION to enter or leave home, which already says a lot about this lady because the supposedly expert and professional to know if a febrile baby should be hospitalized, it is her. We say that to be calmer, since we see that the girl has not improved we prefer her income. He leaves and after a while he returns telling us that there are no beds to hospitalize, he tries to change our mind and we insist. I commented that the girl during the time we have been there has had decomposition, that she has not eaten anything due to lack of appetite and that she noticed that the fever is rising again. He still writes the report and gives it to us so we can leave. I ask her to please look at the fever and give her aspiretal because we live 70 kilometers away and the girl is sick. They take the temperature at 38.8, they give her the aspiretal and she tells us that we can leave. Unfortunately my baby had a terrible night, the fever kept going up and yesterday (Thank God for taking this wise decision) we decided not to go back to her hospital and try at the San Rafael Hospital, where they quickly treated us and hospitalized the baby in less than 1 hour whose first diagnosis was INFLUENZA A. A few months ago I called for an appointment at the Chiron to see a lump in my right breast and, since I was afraid to wait a lot for the SS, I risked going there. Beforehand, they told me by phone that I should go to Orihuela on the date and time indicated and they gave me a fee. I left work and went straight, so to my surprise they tell me that it is not there, that it is in Torrevieja, when I came from work from there and caught me 5 minutes away. I complain and they tell me that it happens very often with those who give appointments and invite me to make a claim, but because I am not bad, I decide not to put it. They send me for another day at the indicated hospital. I went and upon arrival they ask me to pay in advance and it is just double the rate, with what they tell me they are also often wrong. I finally accept. I have a mammogram where my breast is extremely dense and with micronodules, so they recommend an ultrasound because they couldn't see correctly. I agree. In the end I paid in total more than 300 euros. They echo me and the doctor tells me that I have nothing. I was relieved and after 2 weeks they called me from the SS. They do the ultrasound and find me under the package a 7mm nodule cataloged as BIRAD3, which seems benign but should be checked every 6 months just in case. I decided to file the claim. I sent the report and all the possible data and they answer me with a little card where they tell me what their doctors saw me and that's it. No way to fix it, no apologies or anything. To this day I continue complaining that they do not give signs for that claim or provide me with solutions and they already do not answer me. I have lost 300 euros believing that it would be a necessary investment and it has not served me anything more than to lose that money. Unfortunately, shameful, shameful that a private hospital does this and does not try to put solutions to improve its reputation. I would never go back again.

Very happy with the ambulance care and the emergency but the happiness ends there. When moved to the unit I was very unhappy. I was there for two whole days and there were unfortunately a lot of things that could have been much better, starting off with the attitude of the employees. There were a few kind people but the general attitude was horrible. The employees left me with a feeling of being in the way and disturbing. Let me just say, where I live, if just one person had the attitude of an employee here they would be unemployed by the end of the day; it would definitely not be tolerated. This private hospital is supposed to give its customers service, somehow this seems to have been forgotten.

Due to also being pregnant (was hospitalized for severe stomach flu) there were a few ultra sounds which is great. However, three ultra sounds in 48 hours when being told that everything looks great and no explanations can be given to why two exactly the same ultra sounds are done seems suspicious, was something wrong or was there another motive to these ultra sounds?

I want to say thank you the incredibly kind woman in radiology performing the first ultra sound!

It was also very complicated when 90% of the employees doesn't speak one word English and everything has to go through a translater. It was also questioned why I don't eat meat (since over ten years and I'm not about to try meat after such a long time when hospitalized for stomach issues).

Often when people entered the room there was no hello even if I said hello and when I called the phone they often just hung up on me. When I approached the reception I could here the people there starting to talk bad about me, I can understand some Spanish which I think the people working there were very much unaware about.

My visit ended with me forcing my way out of there after being checked out according to SOS.

We will never go back to Mallorca due to the fact that we feel that we can't trust the hospitals here and I hope my comments can help the hospital improve.

Thank you.

I want to thank everyone who looked after me when I unfortunately became ill whilst on holiday in September.   I was admitted on 1st September and spent two nights in Room 131.
